header.title: Risk
header.subtitle: CFaR / ES, fan chart, stress tests and concentration.

ok.title: Controlled risk profile
ok.causeText: Comfortable runway, low Prob(OD), moderate concentration.
ok.solutionText: Set weekly alerts + backtest VaR exceptions.

email.subject: Weekly risk rituals confirmation
email.body: We’ll set a weekly risk summary and track VaR exceptions to secure the trajectory.

call.body: Confirm a weekly ritual with thresholds and alerts.

runway.title: Tight runway (P5 {{runwayP5}} d) — Prob(OD) {{prob}}%
runway.solutionText: Offer −1% discount to top 5 clients for <15d payment + reminders D+3/D+10.

email.subject: Early-payment discount option
email.body: We propose a 1% discount for payments within 15 days on next invoices. Ensures continuity of supply and priority handling.

cfar.title: Cash at Risk p{{alphaPct}} at {{horizon}}d = {{cfar}} • ES = {{es}}
cfar.pbText: Material potential loss at the horizon.
cfar.causeText: Flow volatility + margin pressure on non-KVI SKUs.
cfar.solutionText: Targeted +3–4% increase on non-KVI + stable-margin “eco” bundle.

email.subject: Targeted price update (service unchanged)
email.body: We’ll adjust +3–4% on non-KVI references and add an “eco” bundle at stable margin. Offer and lead times remain unchanged.

call.body: Announce targeted +3–4% on non-KVI + eco alternative.

conc.title: High concentration — HHI {{hhi}}
conc.pbText: Dependence on a few key accounts.
conc.solutionText: Direct-channel campaign (−5% code) targeting 50 repeat buyers.

email.subject: Direct channel −5% (priority access)
email.body: We’re launching a −5% code on the direct channel for repeat purchases. Goal: faster lead time, logistics priority, direct relationship.

call.body: Pitch the −5% direct-channel code to 50 repeat buyers.

email.closing:
Thanks in advance — it helps us ensure continuity of service and short lead times.

Best regards,

call.intro: calling to streamline payment terms and offer a simple option.
call.close: I’ll send the confirmation email now — ok?

csv.invalid: Invalid CSV. Check header and expected columns (see note).

header.title: Revenue Leakage Radar
header.subtitle: Import a sales CSV to detect and quantify revenue/margin leaks.

empty.prompt: Import a CSV (or load the sample) to view revenue/margin leaks.

increments.label: Cash increments
increments.text: Daily net cash series ≈ sales margin + customer payments + banking flows.

model.label: Model
model.text: AR(1) on increments (μ, φ, σ estimated) → 3,000–8,000 simulated paths over 30–180 days.

fan.label: Fan chart
fan.text: Curves show p5, p50 (median) and p95 quantiles of simulated paths.

cfar.label: CFaR / ES
cfar.text: Cash-flow-at-Risk and Expected Shortfall at quantile α: potential ΔCash losses at the horizon.

prob.label: Prob(Overdraft)
prob.text: Share of paths going below €0 at least once before the horizon.

runway.label: Runway P5
runway.text: 5th percentile of days until €0 (∞ if no path crosses 0).

hhi.label: HHI (clients)
hhi.text: Concentration index from client revenue shares (0 = diversified, > 0.2 = high).

stress.label: Stress tests
stress.text: Δ% sales (scaling), Δ% costs (margin pressure), + DSO days (payment delay).
